name: 陳昶瑞
objective: This course is an introduction of real estate finance and investments.  As an overview the course will cover the topics of basic property and contract law, urban economics, appraisal, brokerage, property management, finance, and investment analysis.  This course uses a combination of lectures, case discussions, and projects to study real estate.
schedule:
Week 01: Course Introduction
Week 02: The Nature of Real Estate
Week 03: Real Estate Value
Week 04: Legal Foundations
Week 05: Urban Economics
Week 06: Market Research
Week 07: Appraisal
Week 08: Investment Value
Week 09: Midterm Exam
Week 10: Family Housing
Week 11: Residential Financing
Week 12: Commercial Financing
Week 13: Mortgage Calculation
Week 14: Brokerage
Week 15: Sustainability
Week 16: Development and Management I
Week 17: Development and Management II
Week 18: Final Exam
scorePolicy:
40% - Midterm and Final Exams
30% - Assigned Readings/Assignments
20% - Semester Project
10% - Attendance
materials: Ling, D. and Archer, W. (2012). Real Estate Principles: A Value Approach, 4th Edition, McGraw-Hill.
